subject: RE: [junit] How to record test results in XML format
msgSnippet: Hi Scott, Thanks for the immediate reply!!! You mean, I need to install ANT module??? I am very new to this. Please mail me one example OR atleast let me know
messageBody:
Hi Scott,

Thanks for the immediate reply!!!

You mean, I need to install ANT module???
I am very new to this. Please mail me one example OR
atleast let me know where can I find the documentation
for this.

Thanks and Regards,
Syed.


--- Scott Stirling <scottstirling@...> wrote:
> Easiest way to do it is use the JUnit tasks (<junit>
> and <batchtest>) in
> Ant, which will automatically output results in XML
> format if you tell
> them to. Then use <junitreport> to automatically
> transform the XML into
> a nice framed HTML report.
>
> Scott Stirling
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: s_thoda [mailto:s_thoda@...]
> > Sent: Monday, July 08, 2002 5:28 PM
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: [junit] How to record test results in XML
> format
> >
> >
> > Hi All,
> >
> > We have an Autotest suit using Junit in my
> project. We were
> > generating .txt files to record all the test
> results. I want to use
> > XML for recording all the autotest results. Please
> advice me on how
> > to go about this.
>
>
>
>
